newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Birzai Milk, banks active on Lithuania bourse.
newsitem.headline: Birzai Milk, banks active on Lithuania bourse.

text.p: The Birzai Milk dairy firm was active on the Lithuanian stock exchange on Thursday after the company completed a launch of global depository receipts (GDRs).
Banks were also busy as the bourse as a whole was quiet with trade on the central market coming to just 466,653 litas.
The A group index rose by 12.48 points to 1,501.68.
Birzai Milk rose to 7.84 litas from 6.54 litas on turnover of 67,326 litas and demand for the stock was high at 188,735 shares while supply was a low 8,588 shares.
Among banks, Vilnius Bank rose to 157 litas from 155 litas on turnover of 21,980 litas.
Block trading was more active than the central market and business there came to 1.09 million litas.
Banks were also busy with Hermis Bank turning over 733,000 litas at a price range of 145 to 147 litas while Vilnius Bank turned over 141,800 litas and was traded at 157 litas.
There was no trade in the secondary market of government securities.
